member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart
member.summary: Represents a chart with an ordinal X-axis and a numeric Y-axis.

member.summary: Gets or sets the duration used for animating series plots when the chart is loading into view

member.summary: Gets or sets the duration used for animating series plots when the data is changing

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.TransitionInEasingFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the easing function used for animating series plots when the chart is loading into view
member.remarks: This can be set to one of the known values "linear" or "cubic," or it can be set to an easing function which takes a single numeric parameter and returns a number.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.TransitionEasingFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the easing function used for animating series plots when the data is changing.
member.remarks: This can be set to one of the known values "linear" or "cubic," or it can be set to an easing function which takes a single numeric parameter and returns a number.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.ItemsSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of data items used to generate the chart.
member.remarks: Value of this property can be a list of objects containing one or more numeric properties. Additionally, if the objects in the list implement the IEnumerable interface, the Category Chart will attempt to delve into the sub-collections when reading through the data source. Databinding can be further configured by attributing the data item classes with the DataSeriesMemberIntentAttribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.IncludedProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of property paths that should be included for consideration by the category chart, leaving the remaineder excluded. If null, all properties will be considered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.ExcludedProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of property paths that should be excluded from consideration by the category chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.ChartType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of chart series to generate from the data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.Brushes
member.summary: Gets or sets the palette of brushes to use for coloring the chart series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.Outlines
member.summary: Gets or sets the palette of brushes to use for outlines on the chart series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.Legend
member.summary: Sets the legend to connect this chart to.
member.remarks: When the legend property is set, the chart will use it to display information about its series. Legends can be shared by multiple chart controls.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.IsHorizontalZoomEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the chart can be horizontally zoomed through user interaction.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.IsVerticalZoomEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the chart can be vertically zoomed through user interaction.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.WindowRect
member.summary: Gets or sets the rectangle representing the current scroll and zoom state of the chart.
member.remarks: WindowRect is expressed as a Rectangle with coordinates and sizes between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.Viewport
member.summary: Gets a rectangle representing the bounds of the plot area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets text to display above the plot area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets or sets text to display below the chart Title, above the plot area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.TitleAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets horizontal alignment which determines the title position, relative to the left and right edges of the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.SubtitleAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets horizontal alignment which determines the subtitle position, relative to the left and right edges of the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.UnknownValuePlotting
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior that determines how unknown values will be plotted on the chart.
member.remarks: Null and Double.NaN are two examples of unknown values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.MarkerCollisionAvoidance
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior for markers in each series which are placed too close together for the current view, resulting in a collision.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.IsTransitionInEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether animation of series plots is enabled when the chart is loading into view

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.TransitionInMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the method that determines how to animate series plots when the chart is loading into view

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.TransitionInSpeedType
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrival speed used for animating series plots when the chart is loading into view

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.XAxisInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency of displayed labels along the X-axis.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the set value is a factor that determines which labels will be hidden. For example, an interval of 2 will display every other label.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.XAxisMinorInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency of displayed minor lines along the X-axis.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the set value is a factor that determines how the minor lines will be displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.XAxisGap
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space between adjacent categories for the X-axis.
member.remarks: The gap is silently clamped to the range [0, 1] when used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.XAxisOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of overlap between adjacent categories for the X-axis.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the overlap is silently clamped to the range [-1, 1] when used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.YAxisInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between each label and grid line along the Y-axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.YAxisIsLogarithmic
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Y-axis should use a logarithmic scale instead of a linear one.
member.remarks: Since log(-1) is imaginary and log(0) is undefined, it is recommended to enable this property only when the Y-axis minimum is greater than zero.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.YAxisLogarithmBase
member.summary: Gets or sets the base value to use in the log function when mapping the position of data items along the Y-axis.
member.remarks: This property is effective only when YAxisIsLogarithmic is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering resolution for series in this chart.
member.remarks: Where n = Resolution, for every n horizontal pixels, combine all items into a single datapoint. When Resolution = 0, all datapoints will be rendered as graphical objects. Charts with a higher resolution will have faster performance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.TrendLineBrushes
member.summary: Gets or sets the palette of brushes to used for coloring trend lines in this chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.TrendLineType
member.summary: Gets or sets the formula used for calculating trend lines in this chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.Thickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the chart series. Depending on the ChartType, this can be the main brush used, or just the outline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryChart.MarkerTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of marker shapes used for representing data points of series in this chart.
member.remarks: When MarkerTypes is null or empty, each series' marker type will be set to none or automatic, depending on the series type.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.Series.Legend
member.summary: Gets or sets a legend for the current series object.
member.remarks:
If the Legend property is not set, the series will use the setting according to the parent XamDataChart's Legend property.
This is generally expressed as an element name binding, as the Legend must exist at some other position in the layout. This property only indicates which Legend to use and will not alone cause the legend to be visible.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.AnnotationLayer
member.summary: Represents the base class for annotation layer types. Annotations will usually disable some of the default hover/touch behaviors of the chart when they are introduced to the series collection. In return they provide some valuable information as the cursor is moved by hovering over the chart, or performing a press-hold-drag interaction in touch mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.AnnotationLayer.CursorPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets the world position to use instead of the pointer position for this annotation layer. If you set this value, rather than responding to the pointer, this layer will be fixed on the provided world position. A world position has x and y values that range from 0 to 1 that represent the global position of the cursor relative to the entire ranges of the axes. The default of (NaN, NaN) means that the layer should react to pointer movement.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryHighlightLayer
member.summary:
Represents an annotation layer that targets a category axis, or all category axes in the chart. If the axis contains any series that are aligned between major gridlines of the axis (column, waterfall, etc) this will render a shape that fills the current category. Otherwise it will render a band with an adjustable thickness at the closest gridline to the pointer position.
Setting UseIterpolation to true will cause the x position in the latter case to become affixed to the x position of the pointer.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryItemHighlightLayer
member.summary:
Represents an annotation layer that highlights items in a series that use a category axis either by drawing a banded shape at their position, or by rendering a marker at their position.
Depending on the type of series, the default highlight will be affected. To override the type of highlight used, you can set the HighlightType property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.PolarAxisRenderingManager.GetClosestRadiusValue(Infragistics.Portable.Rect)
member.summary: Determines the smallest radius that is visible in the current view into the chart.
member.param: The window rectangle.
member.returns: The radius value.
member.remarks:
This makes use of the fact that the view into the chart is aligned on the cartesian axes.
So, if the center point of the chart is inside the viewable space, the minimum radius is 0.
If the view into the chart is scrolled above or below the center point, such that the center point is in the X range of the view, then the closest radius is just the distance to the top or bottom edge of the window rectangle.
Similarly, if the view into the chart is left of right of the center point, such that the center point is in the Y range of the view, then the closest radius is just the distance to the left of right edge of the window rectangle.
In the case where the view is deeper into the quadrants of the space, and the center point is neither in the X or Y range of the view, then we simply need to determine what the distance is to the closest corner of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.PolarAxisRenderingManager.GetFurthestRadiusValue(Infragistics.Portable.Rect)
member.summary: Determines the furthest radius value that is viewable in the current view into the chart.
member.param: The window rectangle.
member.returns: The radius value.
member.remarks: In all cases the furthest distance will just be the distance to the furthest corner of the viewing rectangle in scaled viewport space.

The supporting calculations to be used in the calculation.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ItemwiseStrategyBasedIndicator
member.summary: Financial indicator base class for doing calculating an itemwize indicator.
member.remarks: An itemwise indicator's individual values don't depend on any other values in the collection so can always be independently recalculated. Also, because of this, the base class handles all the looping logic and inheritors only need to provide the actual calculation.

member.summary: Specifies the strategy to use for the calculation.

member.summary: Indicator calculation strategy that handles applying an itemwise strategy to the indicator values that are requested to be calculated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ItemwiseStrategyCalculationStrategy.ItemwiseStrategy
member.summary: The strategy that will be applied itemwize across the calculation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ItemwiseStrategyCalculationStrategy.BasedOn(Infragistics.Core.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource,Infragistics.Core.Charts.FinancialCalculationSupportingCalculations)

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.StrategyBasedIndicator
member.summary: A base class for indicator series with simple calculations that separates the calculation responsibility from the other responsibilities of the financial series, this enables easier unit testing and decoupling of individual calculation strategies.
member.remarks: A contract is defined between the financial series and these simple indicator calculations detailing the data which the series agrees to provide the simple indicator calculations, this contract is defined by . If more complex interactions are needed between the indicator calculation and the series, the indicators should instead derive from directly, or some derivative other than

member.summary: Returns a distance value (not necessarily pixels), that indicates how 'close' a world position is to an indexed value in the series. Not every series can necessarily answer this question, it can't or the world position or index is invalid, NaN will be returned.

member.summary: If possible, will return the best available main value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, when searching for the best avaialble value any unknown values will be skipped.
member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.AnchoredRadialSeries.GetSeriesValuePosition(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

member.param: The world coordinate for which to get a value position for
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The position in question, or NaN,NaN if no valid position is available.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryXAxis.ScrollRangeIntoView(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Scrolls the CategoryXAxis so that the provided range is brought into view.
member.param: The minimum category index to bring into view.
The maximum category index to bring into view.
member.remarks:
This method adjusts the WindowRect in order to scroll horizontally to the desired location. This means that the X axis zoom level may change as it tries to fit the minimum and maximum in view. It will not adjust the Y axis zoom level.
Note: The minimum and maximum are expected to be indexes referring to the items inside the CategoryXAxis ItemsSource.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.HighlightingMode
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for series highlighting depending on distance of mouse on hover operation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.HighlightingMode.Closest
member.summary: The highlight starts on closest element of series

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.HighlightingMode.DirectlyOver
member.summary: The highlight starts when directly over element of series

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ChartHitTestMode
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for performing hit testing in the chart/map.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ChartHitTestMode.Auto
member.summary: Automatically decide the appropriate hit test mode for the content.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ChartHitTestMode.Computational
member.summary: Use a computational based approach to determine which series has been hit. This uses loose bounding boxes, in some cases, and can range in time complexity between O(1) and O(log n) to find a hit. This decreases frame render time compared to color encoded.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ChartHitTestMode.ColorEncoded
member.summary: Use a color encoded off screen buffer for hit testing. This can have extremely rare false positives where the wrong series is hit (this is due to our inability to disable anti-aliasing in our color buffer), but should always be O(1) time for determining a hit series. This increases frame render time, however. Consider using this if hit testing time is degrading performance.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ChartHitTestMode.Mixed
member.summary: Let each series decide which hit testing mode to use individually based on their own hit test mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.ChartHitTestMode.MixedFavoringComputational
member.summary: Let each series decide which hit testing mode to use individually based on their own hit test mode, but evaluate all computational hits before evaluating any color encoding hits.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.SeriesHitTestMode
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for performing hit testing in the chart/map.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.SeriesHitTestMode.Auto
member.summary: Automatically decide the appropriate hit test mode for the series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.SeriesHitTestMode.Computational
member.summary: Use a computational based approach to determine whether the series has been hit. This uses loose bounding boxes, in some cases, and can range in time complexity between O(1) and O(log n) to find a hit. This decreases frame render time compared to color encoded.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.SeriesHitTestMode.ColorEncoded
member.summary: Use a color encoded off screen buffer for hit testing. Should always be O(1) time for determining a hit series. This increases frame render time and memory usage, however. Consider using this if hit testing time is degrading performance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Implementation.CategoryYAxis.ScrollRangeIntoView(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Scrolls the CategoryYAxis so that the provided range is brought into view.
member.param: The minimum category index to bring into view.
The maximum category index to bring into view.
member.remarks:
This method adjusts the WindowRect in order to scroll vertically to the desired location. This means that the Y axis zoom level may change as it tries to fit the minimum and maximum in view. It will not adjust the X axis zoom level.
Note: The minimum and maximum are expected to be indexes referring to the items inside the CategoryYAxis ItemsSource.

member.summary: If possible, will return the best available main value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.

member.param: The world coordinate for which to get a value position for
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The position in question, or NaN,NaN if no valid position is available.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Core.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource
member.summary: Represents the data contract between a financial series and the decoupled calculation responsibilities which implement its mathmatical logic.
member.remarks: The FinancialCalculationDataSource contract represents the subset of data which needs to be provided in order to test or run a calculation, and its intentionally a subset of the information available to the series, in order to make calculation strategies more easily testable and usable in isolation to the financial series container.

member.summary: A read only collection of the high values for the financial series that is requesting an indicator calculation

member.summary: A read only collection of the low values for that financial series that is requesting an indicator calculation.

member.summary: A read only collection of the volume values for the financial series that is requesting an indicator calculation.

member.summary: The starting index from which to calculate

member.summary: The number of items from the starting index from which to calculate

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource.MinimumValue
member.summary: If the calculation determines the range of indicator values, it will set the minimum and maximux properties.
member.remarks: This will contain the previous minimum value when the indicator calculation is called again, in case this makes the update of the value speedier.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource.MaximumValue
member.summary: If the calculation determines the range of indicator values, it will set the minimum and maximux properties.
member.remarks: This will contain the previous minimum value when the indicator calculation is called again, in case this makes the update of the value speedier.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource.SpecifiesRange
member.summary: The calculation strategy should set this to true if it specifes the minimum and maximum value properties.
